page.title: 01EAST LINTON DESCRIPTION
page.content: East Linton, a long established village of some 600 people, lies on the River Tyne in the rich coastal plain between the Lammermuir Hills and the North Sea. The surrounding area is mostly used for growing barley, wheat and potatoes. Important road and rail lines by-pass the village, which is a 30 minute drive from Edinburgh, the capital of Scotland. The village has several shops and a Post Office, although many people do shop in the nearby larger towns. The village is quiet and attractive with much character. It is often the haunt of artists who enjoy painting historic Preston Mill. There is considerable community spirit, resulting in a wide variety of clubs and activities for all ages.
